definitions.definition: To kill as punishment for capital crimes.
definitions.example: There are certain states where it is lawful to execute prisoners convicted of certain crimes.

definitions.definition: To carry out; to put into effect.
definitions.example: I'll execute your orders as soon as this meeting is adjourned.
to execute a difficult piece of music brilliantly

definitions.definition: To carry out, to perform an act; to put into effect or cause to become legally binding or valid (as a contract) by so doing.

definitions.example: The program executed, but data problems were discovered.
